dc:metadata.dc:title: The Transformation of Britain, 1830–1939
dc:metadata.dc:creator: G. E. Mingay
dc:metadata.dc:description: First published in 1986, The Transformation of Britain, 1830–1939 delves into the significant changes that occurred across the landscape and society of Britain during this prominent age of reform and innovation.

dc:metadata.dc:title: Rural Life in Victorian England
dc:metadata.dc:creator: G. E. Mingay
dc:metadata.dc:description: During Victoria's reign the English countryside saw more rapid and far-reaching changes than had been experienced in perhaps all the preceding centuries. These changes were the result of increasing industrialization, the move toward urban settlement, greater reliance on imported foodstuffs and the mass-production of fabric and clothing.

dc:metadata.dc:title: A Concise History of Russia
dc:metadata.dc:creator: Paul Bushkovitch
dc:metadata.dc:description: Accessible to students, tourists and general readers alike, this book provides a broad overview of Russian history since the ninth century. Paul Bushkovitch emphasizes the enormous changes in the understanding of Russian history resulting from the end of the Soviet Union in 1991.
